result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard C Helper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard C Helper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard C Helper was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Jail.
Credit For Time Served 116 Days.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation by the end of Probation and/or 46 hours of Community Service to be completed by 03-06-2016.  Court must receive notice of completion prior to 03-06-2016.

DNA Sample WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Referred to Department Vocational Rehabilitation.

Maintain full time employment when able - in Lieu of employment the Court Orders 20 hours of Community Service each week of Probation.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Rerred to DAy ReCenter for 6 months.  Can start at anytime.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Obtain a valid driver's license within First 6 months subject to Mental Health Evaluation and approval of the Agent.
No contact with victim or her address
DNA Sample WAIVED.  Pay Surcharge.

Visitation permitted if in Waukesha.

Count #1 Dismissed.
